questions.question: What is the detection limit of L-arginine by the H8L-Mn-MOF?
Which amino acid does the H8L-Mn-MOF selectively recognize over L-lysine and other amino acids?
What is the role of the tetratopic phosphonate ligand in the Mn-MOF?
questions.answer: It is used for selective recognition of L-arginine over L-lysine and other amino acids.

questions.question: What bio-fluids was the H8L-Mn-MOF tested in for its responsive behaviour?
questions.answer: Fatal bovine serum and human urine

questions.question: What is the significance of detecting L-arginine in the context of the study?
questions.answer: Detecting L-arginine helps immensely towards preparing a paediatric reference range for clinical use and detecting patients with 'Sepsis'.

questions.question: What method was used to support the selective 'Turn-On' behaviour of the MOF upon interaction with L-arginine?
Why does the H8L-Mn-MOF remain in a fluorescent quenched state in aqueous medium?
questions.answer: Because of the presence of paramagnetic metal centres (MnII).

questions.question: How does the interaction with L-arginine affect the fluorescence of the H8L-Mn-MOF?
questions.answer: The interaction with electron-rich L-arginine causes the MOF to show selective 'Turn-On' behaviour.

questions.question: What makes the H8L-Mn-MOF suitable for bio-applicability?
questions.answer: Its equal responsive behaviour in different bio-fluids such as fatal bovine serum and human urine.

questions.question: How does the structure of the H8L-Mn-MOF contribute to its function in arginine sensing?
questions.answer: The tetratopic phosphonate ligand structure allows for selective recognition of L-arginine over other amino acids.

questions.question: What could be the clinical significance of detecting L-arginine in serum and human urine?
questions.answer: It could help in preparing a paediatric reference range for clinical use and in detecting 'Sepsis' disease.

questions.question: Why is selective detection of amino acids in aqueous medium important in biomedical research?
questions.answer: Because it can offer a reliable diagnostic tool.

questions.question: The H8L-Mn-MOF can detect L-lysine with a lower detection limit than L-arginine.
DFT studies were not used to support the selective 'Turn-On' behaviour of the MOF.
The H8L-Mn-MOF shows a 'Turn-Off' behaviour upon interaction with L-arginine.
The detection of L-arginine by the H8L-Mn-MOF has no relevance to 'Sepsis' disease.
The H8L-Mn-MOF was only tested in aqueous medium for its responsive behaviour.
The presence of paramagnetic metal centres (MnII) causes the MOF to remain in a fluorescent quenched state in aqueous medium.
The H8L-Mn-MOF is incapable of detecting L-arginine in bio-fluids other than water.
